summary: This bill, the 'Designation of English as the Official Language of the United States Act of 2025,' aims to declare English as the official language of the U.S. It mandates official government functions to be conducted in English and establishes a uniform English language rule for naturalization. The bill specifies the scope of “official” functions, outlines exceptions (teaching languages, national security, etc.), and sets rules for the construction of laws. It also calls for implementing regulations from the Secretary of Homeland Security.  The bill was influenced by a previous executive order.
